summary: Ann Furnald Taylor was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents provided are payroll certifications indicating she was employed by the committee from at least February 1977 through December 1977. The payroll certifications list her name and salary, confirming her employment during that period. The documents do not provide specific details about her role within the committee, but her presence on the payroll indicates she was a staff member.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Ann Furnald Taylor's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with investigating the assassination of JFK. While the documents do not specify her role, her employment contributes to the overall staffing and operation of the committee during its investigation.
